text:
Hi guys,

I'm in the process of writing down tempaltes for pages created using the Visual Builder in HUbspot. From all my research so far I understand there's no way of adding custom classes to dnd_rows or dnd_columns but I see I have the option of adding a custom class to the dnd_area tag. I see that it's possible to add multiple dnd_areas on a html+hubl template however I haven't seen anything like this in practice yet.

Bearing in mind that I NEED classes in order to make sure that when I apply a template to a page and then the user comes in and edits that, the CSS will remain the same for the sections in the original template my questions is: Would it be okay to use a dnd_area for each section of a page so that I can add custom classes to each section?

What's your take on this?
Hi <@U01G3MX698T>, are those file included by any change in the Template file or in the Page Settings by any chance?
